results.title: Stage struck
results.brief_description: The Australian performing arts makes its debut on the interactive stage with this vibrant CD ROM. Embark on an exciting tour of the theatre, visiting the various studios to construct a costume, create a script, or design and direct your own show. As you explore backstage you will discover a wealth of information on Australia’s entertainment industry. Take a tour on stage with a stage manager, or hang out in the Green Room with the artists and discover the range of performing arts companies. This CD ROM was made possible through a collaboration between NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Art), the University of Wollongong, The Australian Ballet, Opera Australia, and the Sydney Opera House. Easy to install, nice graphics and good sound. Comes with an instruction sheet to assist with navigation.

results.title: St Barbe of the trees
results.creator_credit: Barrie Oldfield and M B Oldfield and Sons
results.brief_description: Presents 92 year-old Richard St Barbe Baker, the man who founded the international movement “Men of the Trees” in 1922, talking about trees: their life-giving qualities, the threats to them from disease and overfelling; and the need to plant for our lives. The first half of the film is scientific in approach while the second half becomes more lyrical with St Barbe reciting his favourite tree poems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barrie Oldfield and M B Oldfield and Sons

results.title: Repulsion motor principles
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Explains construction of repulsion motor, rotor circuits and effects of brush position; short-circuiting and brush-lifting mechanism; and application of repulsion motors. This film is a technical training film on the design and construction of repulsion brush type electric A.C. motors as used in the first half of this century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Squirrel-cage rotor principles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Laws of magnetism and induced electromagnetic fields.; electric flow in squirrel-cage rotor setting up magnetic poles which create torque; construction of squirrel-cage rotors.

results.title: Single-phase and polyphase circuits
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
A training film explaining a single-phase synchronous generator; the use of sine curves to illustrate flow change; a two-phase system and three-phase system and ways to simplify wiring.

results.title: Split-phase motor principles
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Construction of stator and rotor; comparison of winding in two-phase stator with split-phase stator; effects of winding resistances and inductive reactances; and use of capacitor to produce phase displacement.
